summary: Provides a transpiler pass that converts arbitrary two‑qubit operations into a sequence of echoed cross‑resonance (RZX) gates using the Weyl decomposition, limiting each original gate to at most six non‑echoed RZX components.
business_intent: Facilitates hardware‑aware compilation by expressing generic two‑qubit gates in terms of the native echoed RZX interaction, thereby reducing gate count, improving execution fidelity, and simplifying mapping to superconducting quantum processors.
